Description: Lower body sherd of Corinthian pottery globular aryballos; exterior: painted decoration consisting of quatrefoil motif; part of undetermined decoration on opposite side of sherd; inscription in added red on bottom.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For parallels regarding quatrefoil patterns on aryballoi, see Payne (1931), p. 147. The sherd is also published in Johnston: ABSA 70 (1975) p.148 no. 6; Rasmussen & Spivey: Looking at Greek Vases p. 219, fig. 92.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 221)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 74, no. A77)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (170, no. 25)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.301) (phase 3)
